headline: Tapestry pens pact to sell Stuart Weitzman brand to Caleres for $105 million in cash
summary: Tapestry Inc. says it has penned an agreement to sell the Stuart Weitzman brand to Caleres, a portfolio of footwear brands for $105 million in cash.  Tapestry said Wednesday that selling the brand would enable the fashion company to focus on sustaining the growth of Coach, while reinvigorating sales at Kate Spade.  Meanwhile Caleres said that buying Stuart Weitzman would help accelerate sales, with the luxury brand being the lead label in its portfolio.

raw.headline: Tapestry pens pact to sell Stuart Weitzman brand to Caleres for $105 million in cash
raw.summary: Tapestry Inc. says it has penned an agreement to sell the Stuart Weitzman brand to Caleres, a portfolio of footwear brands for $105 million in cash.  Tapestry said Wednesday that selling the brand would enable the fashion company to focus on sustaining the growth of Coach, while reinvigorating sales at Kate Spade.  Meanwhile Caleres said that buying Stuart Weitzman would help accelerate sales, with the luxury brand being the lead label in its portfolio.

headline: Tapestry to Sell Stuart Weitzman to Caleres for $105 Million
summary: Tapestry has struck a deal to sell its Stuart Weitzman shoe brand to footwear seller Caleres for $105 million in cash.

raw.headline: Tapestry to Sell Stuart Weitzman to Caleres for $105 Million
raw.summary: Tapestry has struck a deal to sell its Stuart Weitzman shoe brand to footwear seller Caleres for $105 million in cash.

headline: Coach parent Tapestry to sell Stuart Weitzman footwear brand for $105 million
summary: The divestment comes months after Tapestry said it was focused on driving growth for its organic business and had "significant runway ahead" following a derailed $8.5 billion merger deal with Michael Kors-owner Capri.  While Tapestry witnessed strong demand for Coach's Tabby handbags in the holiday quarter, Kate Spade and Stuart Weitzman struggled due to weak luxury spending in North America and China.

raw.headline: Coach parent Tapestry to sell Stuart Weitzman footwear brand for $105 million
raw.summary: The divestment comes months after Tapestry said it was focused on driving growth for its organic business and had "significant runway ahead" following a derailed $8.5 billion merger deal with Michael Kors-owner Capri.  While Tapestry witnessed strong demand for Coach's Tabby handbags in the holiday quarter, Kate Spade and Stuart Weitzman struggled due to weak luxury spending in North America and China.

headline: Caleres to Acquire Tapestry’s Stuart Weitzman for $105 Million
summary: Tapestry will now focus on Coach and Kate Spade, while Caleres strengthens its position in the women's market.

raw.headline: Caleres to Acquire Tapestry’s Stuart Weitzman for $105 Million
raw.summary: Tapestry will now focus on Coach and Kate Spade, while Caleres strengthens its position in the women's market.

headline: Tapestry, Inc. Enters Into Definitive Agreement to Sell Stuart Weitzman Brand to Caleres
summary: NEW YORK, February 19, 2025--Tapestry, Inc. (NYSE: TPR), a house of iconic accessories and lifestyle brands, today announced that it entered into a definitive agreement to sell the Stuart Weitzman brand to Caleres (NYSE: CAL), a market-leading portfolio of consumer-driven footwear brands, for $105 million in cash, subject to customary adjustments.

raw.headline: Tapestry, Inc. Enters Into Definitive Agreement to Sell Stuart Weitzman Brand to Caleres
raw.summary: NEW YORK, February 19, 2025--Tapestry, Inc. (NYSE: TPR), a house of iconic accessories and lifestyle brands, today announced that it entered into a definitive agreement to sell the Stuart Weitzman brand to Caleres (NYSE: CAL), a market-leading portfolio of consumer-driven footwear brands, for $105 million in cash, subject to customary adjustments.

headline: Tapestry to sell Stuart Weitzman for $105M
summary: The deal allows the Coach owner to double down on its handbag brands, which have recently driven it to record growth.
